Astonished to learn that on 14 Jan @EnvAgency Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA told the Public Accounts Committee that "we are not allowing people to discharge sewage into chalk streams".

Did he intentionally mislead or does he not know that it happens? 

https://t.co/HW3zHY8zIP

tweets.text: If the the @EnvAgency CEO @JamesBevanEA is not aware that sewage is discharged into chalk streams what chance have we got. The @RiverChess has had 79 sewage discharges over a 16 month period between 24 Sept 2019 and 25th Jan 2021.

@agricontract @EnvAgency @Pxfarms have clearly demonstrated round me how good ditch management reduces flooding issues.James assured the villagers at an evening meeting with his reasoning and two wet winter later ZERO problem,yes of course we then look to manage the soil as well to retain it in the field

@RiverChess @thameswater have turned the River Chess from a rare chalkstream into a cheap extension of their sewerage network. What is the @EnvAgency doing to prevent this destruction of a precious natural resource?
